model_solution:
Step 1:  We can simplify the expression by first rewriting each radical in terms of its prime factorization.
$\sqrt{15}\cdot\sqrt{35}=\sqrt{3\cdot5}\cdot\sqrt{5\cdot7}$
Step 2: $\sqrt{3\cdot5}\cdot\sqrt{5\cdot7}=\sqrt{3\cdot5^2\cdot7}$
Step 3: $\sqrt{3\cdot5^2\cdot7}=\boxed{5\sqrt{21}}$
Step 4: $\sqrt{3\cdot5^2\cdot7}=\sqrt{3\cdot5^2}\cdot\sqrt{7}=5\sqrt{3\cdot7}=5\sqrt{21}$
Step 5: $5\sqrt{3\cdot7}=5\sqrt{21}$
Step 6: $\sqrt{3\cdot5^2\cdot7}=\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{5^2}\cdot\sqrt{7}=\sqrt{3}\cdot5\sqrt{7}=5\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}$
Step 7: $\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}=\sqrt{3\cdot7}=\sqrt{21}$
Step 8: $\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}=\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}=\sqrt{21}$
$\sqrt{3}\cdot\sqrt{7}=\sqrt{3\cdot7}=\sqrt{21}$
Step 9: $\boxed{5\sqrt{21}}$

full_steps:
